availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William R. Gerhart (Lancaster, PA, US Colored Troops officer in KY)

body.p: Lancaster, Pennsylvania, soldier. Gettysburg, Pennsylvania, native. Son of Emanuel N. Gerhart and Eliza Gerhart. Graduated from Franklin and Marshall College in Lancaster. Resident of Hamilton County, Ohio, in 1850. Served in the Nevinâ€™s Pennsylvania Volunteer Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as first sergeant and second lieutenant from July 2, 1861. Served in the 121st United States Colored Infantry Regiment as major from August 17, 1864, to June 30, 1865. Served in the 125th United States Colored Infantry Regiment as major and colonel from July 25, 1865, to December 14, 1867.

ab.bibl:

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served the United States Colored Troops: 56th-138th USCT Infantry, 1864-1866, NARA Roll RG94-USCT-121-Bx06.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served the United States Colored Troops: 56th-138th USCT Infantry, 1864-1866, NARA Roll RG94-USCT-125-Bx20.
